result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:59 AM - Case not called on the Record
Intern Abigail Kincheloe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Edward Flournoy. 
Defendant Edward Flournoy appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.
Attorney Menden requests another hearing date.  Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:50 PM Defendant Edward Flournoy appeared by Zoom, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden who appeared by Zoom.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
THE DEFENDANT IS CURRENTLY INCARCERATED AT MSDF, HOW THE DEFENDANT APPEARS AT THE NEXT COURT DATE WILL BE LEFT UP TO THE DISCRETION OF THE TRIAL COURT.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Detainer placed at: Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with the co-defendant (Domonique A Fears Jones)/Acura Car Dealership/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C/Witness D listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:47 PM Defendant Edward Flournoy in court by zoom video, in custody at Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Attorney Menden anticipates this case being a waiver of preliminary hearing and requests a date for waiver so the defendant may appear by zoom.  Court sets matter back for a potential waiver of preliminary hearing.  Clerk's office to set up video appearance for the defendant from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
